ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: In this course, you will hear about everything you already know. I would not recommend it but you have no choice.
They have to take it anyway.
Responsible conduct of research is essential for all student scientists at Yale. I would encourage students to take the class seriously.
I would recommend the course, it focuses on an important piece of appropriate behavior in science and provides a space to discuss cases of scientific misconduct that are relevant everyday.
It's definitely important information to know. I would definitely recommend it, and anyways it's required.
This is a required course. I would have preferred not to take it. Most of what was presented was what I believe to be common knowledge.
Yes. You must know about these topics! They're all important. This course is also required by NIH.
I would recommend this course because it covers a wide range of topics, which are interesting and which research students should be familiar with.
It is a required course. With that said, it is actually enjoyable, so if it was not required, I'd recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It did not deepen my knowledge. It might be helpful for when I write a paper.

This course was helpful in ensuring that I understood what is appropriate and acceptable at Yale. It will certainly be helpful, not only in my dissertation/research, but also in my school life on the whole.
It's good to remind you just to be mindful of these things. Everybody is going to encounter something from that class in their own research life and it was a good way to get us all thinking about it.
This is a great refresher for going forward with doctoral research.
This course increased my awareness of ethical concerns that may be present while conducting research.
This helped a lot with my understanding of what it is that goes on beyond the research aspect of doing research.
